alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 14 at 4:01PM EDT until October 15 at 12:33AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maine... Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Swift River at Roxbury. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, parts of Route 17 in Byron become covered with water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1245 AM EDT.
